means: 夸张地宣传（某人或某事物）

sentence.Network_en: We are certainly seeing a lot of hype by some companies.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们无疑已经看到来自一些公司的大肆宣传。

sentence.Network_en: We had to hype the film to attract the financiers.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们不得不热炒这部电影以吸引投资人。

sentence.Network_en: The hype and fervour surrounding the event positively invited scepticism.
sentence.Network_cn: 围绕这件事的大肆渲染和热情必然会引起人们的怀疑.

derivation.yuyuan_name: 1920s (originally US in the sense 'short-change, cheat', or 'person who cheats etc.'): of unknown origin

entry.tran: 天花乱坠的广告宣传;炒作
entry.def: Hype is the use of a lot of publicity and advertising to make people interested in something such as a product.

example.ex: We are certainly seeing a lot of hype by some companies...
example.tran: 我们无疑已经看到来自一些公司的大肆宣传。

example.ex: My products aren't based on advertising hype, they sell by word of mouth.
example.tran: 我的产品销售靠的不是天花乱坠的广告宣传，而是良好的口碑。

entry.def: To hype a product means to advertise or praise it a lot.

example.ex: We had to hype the film to attract the financiers...
example.tran: 我们不得不热炒这部电影以吸引投资人。

example.ex: These gurus are being promoted by publishers and hyped in the business press.
example.tran: 这些权威得到了出版商的力推和商务出版界的大肆宣传。

auth_sentence.content: There was so much hype after the Olympics.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was so much hype after the Olympics.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was so much hype after the Olympics.

auth_sentence.content: Will the Stone Roses reunion match the hype?
auth_sentence.res_content: Will the Stone Roses reunion match the hype?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Will the Stone Roses reunion match the hype?

auth_sentence.content: I am more fascinated by the verbal hype.
auth_sentence.res_content: I am more fascinated by the verbal hype.

abbreviation.mean_en: hypodermic (underground slang=person who injects drugs with a hypodermic syringe)
abbreviation.mean_cn: 皮下注射者(俚语)用皮下注射器注射药物的人

sentences.en: People went to see the movie because of all the hype.
sentences.cn: 人们因各种天花乱坠的广告宣传而去看那部电影。
推销商大肆宣传那部电影。

means.word_mean: 夸张地宣传(某人或某事物)

sentences.en: His latest movie is being hyped up by the media.
sentences.cn: 他新近的电影正被媒体大肆炒作。

means.word_mean: (用巧计或绝技)人为地刺激,助长

sentences.en: They’re so lacking in confidence in the attraction of the games they televise that they feel they have to hype up with some hysterical commentator in order to get anyone to watch them.
sentences.cn: 他们对于用电视播映比赛的吸引力太缺乏信心,以至于他们感到必须要用一个说得天花乱坠的讲解员来做实况广播,以便招揽观众。

means.word_mean: 十分兴奋的；很激动的；十分担忧的

sentences.en: She gets very hyped up before a race.
sentences.cn: 她一到赛跑前就来了精神。
